intro: Euryops trifidus, commonly known as the three-lobed daisies, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow daisy-like flowers with white ray florets and a central disc of yellow tubular flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in full sun. Euryops trifidus is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
